VincentBenjamin is a specialized recruitment and consulting firm with an extensive network of premier companies and professionals throughout the Southwest. The firm’s core business is to provide contingency direct-hire search and contract placement services for employers while assisting candidates in the fields of Accounting and Information Technology. VincentBenjamin place professionals from staff to c-suite executive management positions across all major industries. The team consists of experienced recruiters many of whom have functional experience within the specific areas the serve. VincentBenjamin was recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of America’s Fastest Growing Private Companies in 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2016.

In Oct 2003, Ben joined Robert Half Finance and Accounting, an international recruiting firm. In Ben’s second year as a finance and accounting recruiter, he was recognized by Robert Half Int as the highest producing recruiter in the West Coast. In 2007, Ben was recognized by Robert Half Int as one the highest producing recruiters internationally.

Raised in the United Kingdom, Ben started his career in London, England with Goldman Sachs & Co before relocating to California to join a newly acquired unit of Korn/Ferry International as Director of West Coast Business Development. Ben has been conducting specialized recruitment since 2000 and has assisted thousands of companies achieve their hiring objectives. Prior to VincentBenjamin, Ben was with an S&P 500 specialized recruitment company where he focused on direct-hire search for senior finance and accounting professionals and was recognized on multiple occasions as one of the highest global producers.

Jeanette Hauser
Happily Retired
October 24, 2009, Jeanette was a client of Ben’s

While I was the Firm Administrator for the Phoenix office of Moss Adams (and its predecessor firm, Epstein, Weber & Conover), I had the opportunity of using Ben's services as a Recruiter.  He quickly became the Gold Standard of what a professional recruiter should be doing.  He took the time to learn what kind of candidate would be successful in our business (twice - the cultures were different between MA and EWC), and only presented candidates that he felt would be a fit.  He did not do what most recruiters do - throw everything at the wall and see what sticks.  He never wasted my time, always returned my phone calls, and worked hard to fill our gaps in staffing - often in other areas of our firm beyond the typical audit and tax positions.  He was the only recruiter that I worked with that looked at our firm as a whole, not just a company that did accounting.Ben was also remarkable for his honesty.  He would tell me the strong points of a candidate as well as the possible drawbacks, helping us to fully ascertain their qualities.  This resulted in few, if any, bad hires.  I would not hesitate to use Ben again, and more importanly, I have recommended him over and over, to other firms need his services as well as candidates looking for an honest recruiter.
Jeanette Hauser

I've know Ben for quite some time. He is one of the best recruiting professionals that I have had the opportunity to work with. All recruiters aren't built the same. His three main traits that make him a good resource are: 1. Work Ethic - Ben works hard and he does what he says he's going to do it in a timely manner.2. Professional Judgement - Ben tells it like it is. He is a good judge of character and talent.3. Helpful - Ben will go out of his way to help, even when it's inconvenient. He's a good resource and can be counted on.I hope to continue working with Ben and would highly recommend him.
